result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua Lyle Roth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant may petition for early termination of probation term after completion of 18 months, provided request is joined by agent and all financial obligations are paid in full and all treatment programming is completed.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed. Uncharged offense of Bail Jumping stemming from an incident July 31, 2016 dismissed and read in.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: Same repayment conditions as noted in Count 1.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

JOC returned by USPS - Moved left no address - Unable to Forward

Case called @ 3:37 p.m. Defendant Joshua Lyle Roth in court with attorney Brian T. Kane.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised of permissible punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Upon motion of the State the Court amends Ct 1 to Misdemeanor Bail Jumping contrary to Wis Stat 946.49(1)(a). Plea: Cts 1 & 2 - NC. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Uncharged incident from July 31, 2016 for bail jumping dismissed and read in. 16TR555 - DRI. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Atty Kane. No statement by DE. Court orders: S/W 2 years probation as to both counts concurrent - Conditions: AODA and follow through,  defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, defendant may not be present upon the premises of any bars, defendant is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP, DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Defendant may petition for early termination of probation after a period of 18 months provided the request is joined by the agent. Appeal rights given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 30, 2016 at 03:15 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Brian T. Kane in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Kane requests plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 30, 2016 at 03:15 pm.
Status conference on August 30, 2016 at 09:25 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD:  Case Called @ 2:00 PM: Attorney Brian T. Kane in court, appearing via telephone.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per Atty Kane:  Counsel are awaiting information from another County - requesting further scheduling after 8/18/16.   STC rescheduled as requested.  Status conference scheduled for August 30, 2016 at 09:25 am.
for a New Court Date - 7/20/2016 P/S - Hearing will be conducted as a Telephone STC
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 20, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Per Atty Kane - offer extended this morning that needs to be reviewed with his client. P/S scheduled as requested.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 20, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Status conference on June 14, 2016 at 09:15 am.

16CF-56 and 16TR-555 - Both Cases Called @ 1:55 PM: Defendant Joshua Lyle Roth in court with attorney Brian T. Kane.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed. Defendant wishes to waive preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of preliminary hearing in its entirety.   Def BOT.  ARGN to proceed.  INFO Filed - INFO Stated - Reading Waived.  NGP rec'd and entered as to both matters.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for June 14, 2016 at 09:15 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 28, 2016 at 02:15 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case Called @ 2:49 PM: Defendant Joshua Lyle Roth in court, appearing pro se.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def wants counsel - has SPD in Tomah case.  Def does not qualify for services here in Waushara.  Def states he was recently unemployed.  No sources of income - assets stated. The Court:  Will appoint counsel upon the payment of a deposit of $250 no later than 4/15/2016 - a PP of $50 per mo to commence on 5/1/2016.  ADA argues as to bond of $2500 Signature Bond w/conditions.  No statement by Def as to bond request.  NGP entered as to TR matter and to track along.   AIA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 28, 2016 at 02:15 pm.
